Location: 2400 West Bradley E building Champaign, IL 61821
Description: Help Adults in our commnity improve thier English, basic Math, or Reading, and be a part of a warm and energetic community of kind and talented volunteers.  Project READ (parkland.edu/projectread) helps adults improve their skills in basic reading, basic math, or English as a second language. This program is made possible by volunteers who give their time to improve the quality of life for hundreds of people in our community. Tutors and learners meet regularly at the Champaign Public Library, The Urbana Free Library, Wesley Food Pantry, Champaign Unit 4 Schools, CU FAIR: Champaign Urbana Friends & Allies of Immigrants & Refugees, Rantoul Public Library, and many other public places in our community and throughout our region. Tutors might be homemakers, retirees from any profession, college students, working professionals, or former adult learners. Learners are older teens and adults age 17 to 80+, who want to improve their lives and the lives of their families.

Our mission at the SFYMCA is to provide support and hope for members of the Champaign-Urbana and surrounding communities who need us most. Some members of the community need us for childcare services; others need us for inclusion services; others need us for medical and health support while others need us for emotional support. Because of that, we never turn away people based on financial ability to pay. In 2018, we awarded over $250,000 in financial assistance to over 1,400 people and the some of the funds that enable us to do this are raised by volunteer campaigners from our community. We are needing about 5 more volunteers to join our cause.

Do you have a passion for history and want to pass it onto others? The Museum of the Grand Prairie is looking for volunteers to be part of our new Museum Docent program! Attend this training session and workshop to learn how you can become a museum docent and lead tour groups through museum exhibits. Participants will receive an outline of the program and exhibit study sources, as well as tips & tricks to lead an engaging museum tour. If you cannot attend this workshop/training, another session is available February 2nd. Later this spring, there will be a follow-up optional training session April 24th for docents to meet together again to compare notes and discuss ideas. Ages 16 & up. FREE. RSVP by March 10 with Pat Cain: (217) 586-2612 or pcain@ccfpd.org.

Event Name: Spring Break at the Museum - Quill Writing
Description: Not sure what to fill your day with this spring break? Stop by the Museum for fun-filled activities every day! Try your hand at writing with a quill feather and more hand-writing technologies from the past. Take yourself back in time and write a letter like many did centuries ago!

Event Name: Spring Break at the Museum - Fun with Textiles
Description: Not sure what to fill your day with this spring break? Stop by the Museum for fun-filled activities every day! Do you happen to know how the clothes on your back were made? Or how your bedding was crafted? Come and try your hand at old fashioned textile methods!

Event Name: Spring Break at the Museum - Butter Churning
Description: Not sure what to fill your day with this spring break? Stop by the Museum for fun-filled activities every day! We need your help churning this treat! Join us as we create butter using various methods that require just a little cream and no electricity. For more info: (217) 586-2612 or pcain@ccfpd.org.

Event Name: Spring Break at the Museum - Candle Dipping
Description: Not sure what to fill your day with this spring break? Stop by the Museum for fun-filled activities every day! During the 19th century, candles were the most common form of interior lighting. Dip a wick in some candle wax and take home your very own classic candle!

Help at our rescue any morning of the week by doing 'morning chores'.  Our barn manager needs help in the morning temporarily while the normal helper gets shoulder surgery.  He can direct the new person on what to do.  We need help every day probably though March but any days covered helps.  Horse experience is helpful but not necessary. Every morning we refill water buckets for horses staying in( when it is too cold, windy, or stormy to go out).  We distribute hay and grain to approximately 30 rescue horses awaiting adoption, being rehabilitated, or in sanctuary care.  Some horses are haltered and led out into the pastures.  Other horses run out of their stalls to their pastures and we just need to open their stall doors. If you have a morning free, think about the benefits of helping S.H.A.R.E. by committing an hour and a half to doing morning chores.  It will get you up and outside to start the day.  You feel good afterwards about helping a good cause.  You don't have to have horse experience to be of help.  If interested in volunteering, contact the volunteer coordinator, Heide at heidefogal@aol.com or call the Kim at 217-649-3232.

Event Name: Spring Break at the Museum - Civil War Craft & Activity Day
Description: Not sure what to fill your day with this spring break? Stop by the Museum for fun-filled activities every day! The Civil War was an influential time in United States history. Join us for a day of fun and learning as we provide hands-on activities to bring this period in history to life!

Event Name: Volunteers Needed for the disAbility Resource Expo!
Description: The DisABILITY Resource Expo relies on the involvement of numerous volunteers, to continue its impact as an exciting, community-wide activity. Volunteers are needed to serve on various planning committees leading up to the event, and many more are needed on event-weekend, helping with set-up, greeting exhibitors and guests, supervising Childrens’ Activities, assisting guests/exhibitors/entertainers, and helping with tear-down, clean-up, & move-out at event completion.

Want to help students and other Urbana residents get around safely in winter?  Sign up to help shovel snow! Keeping sidewalks passable means students and other residents can make it to their destinations without using the street or being uncomfortable and damp after trudging through deep snow.

This year’s Boneyard artists will include works by local young women and girls, featuring Franklin STEAM Academy Sisterhood participants responding to themes present in our new exhibit How Long Must Women Wait? Woman Suffrage and Women’s Rights in Champaign County. At the same time you can come enjoy a visit to the Museum and make your own art. We will have multimedia materials available for you to make and take your own amazing masterpiece! All ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. FREE.

Providing tutoring for 1-2 Jr. High Students after school.

Volunteers assist our store team in the preparing donated merchandise for the selling floor. Duties include unpacking, sorting, hanging, and moving merchndsie under the direction of a Connection's store assocaite. Must be 18 or older. Must have experience relating to duties listed. Will be required to provide resume and professional references. Volunteer availability can be discussed at initial interview. Volunteer(s) must submit an application: http://courageconnection.org/get-involved/volunteer/opportunities/volunt.... Once application has been reviewed, Courage Connection will directly contact the individual(s).

Location: 2400 West Bradley E building Champaign, IL 61821
Description: Summer Meals for Kids

The Salvation Army Family Thrift Store sells lightly used clothing and furniture items. The Family Thrift Store is open Monday through Friday from 9am – 5pm, and Saturdays from 9am – 6pm.  Donations are accepted daily during those hours.  All proceeds from the sale of donated items support the Social Service programs that assist residents of Champaign County.

Event Name: Girl Scouts of Central Illinois - Ways to Volunteer
Location: 2001 ROUND BARN RD Suite C CHAMPAIGN, IL 61820
Description: We believe in those who push themselves. Those who challenge themselves. Celebrate themselves. We believe in the mothers, the daughters, and the everyday role models. We believe in those who go above and beyond when it comes to making a difference in girls' lives. We believe in our community, where every G.I.R.L. (Go-getter, Innovater, Risk-taker, Leader) has an opportuntiy to shine and accomplish amazing things. All in a girl-led, girl-friendly environment in which girls always feel free to stand up, speak up, explore, and be theirselves. We believe in one another. We believe in YOU! And guess what? We need you and so do the girls. Believe in the power of a leader. Believe in the power of G.I.R.L. Volunteer today! Everything a Girl Scout does centers around STEM, outdoors, life skills, and entrepreneurship. Whether you can give a few hours, a few weeks, or a few months, volunteering with Girl Scouts is flexible and fun. For more information on the ways you can make a difference please visit our website or contact: Melissa Guthrie, Member Recruitment Specialist, 217-372-5385 or mguthrie@girlscouts-gsci.org. **this is not a volunteer opportunity for a specific event but rather an ongoing volunteer opportunity working with local Girl Scout troops.

The Give Back Garden, operated by Champaign-Urbana Public Health District (CUPHD), grows fresh produce to supplement the food distributed by local food pantries and child nutrition programs.  The garden consists of 30 raised beds on the north side of the CUPHD property, a pergola and more raised beds on the south side of the property, and plans to continue growing and expanding.  Both annual and perennial food crops are grown to help our low-income residents have greater access to fresh fruits and vegetables.  Volunteers help in a variety of ways: seed starting and transplanting, watering, weeding, harvesting, preparing food for distribution, general garden maintenance, and special projects.

Event Name: 2019 Salvation Army of Champaign County Toy Shop Sign-Ups
Description: Toy Shop Volunteers are asked to commit to a two hour shift.  Volunteer opportunities are: Set-up:  Scheduled for November 5- November 8 from 8:30 am - 4:00 pm at The Salvation Army Red Shield Center, 2212 N. Market Street, Champaign. Volunteers needed to help with Christmas Sign-Ups.

Food Pantry Workers provide a valuable service to The Salvation Army in Champaign.   These volunteers stock shelves with donated items, pack boxes and bags with food for meals for Champaign County families, and organize donated products.  Our Food Pantry Workers are special people who can show compassion and love to their neighbors who may be in a crisis situation.  A good ear, kind heart, and an easy smile  make you an ideal candidate for this position.

Event Name: Group Volunteer Project: Douglass Branch DIY Program Volunteers
Description: We are looking for a University of Illinois student organization for this weekly group volunteer opportunity. Volunteers are needed to assist with the Library's DIY kids programs at the Douglass Branch Library. Volunteers will assist children with DIY activities (crafts, science projects, etc.). The shift is weekly on Wednesdays from 3:30 p.m. to 5:30 p.m. with no more than five volunteers at a time. The Douglass Branch Library is located at 504 E. Grove Street, Champaign, IL 61820. We would suggest having at least one driver for each group to take volunteers to the Douglass Branch Library.

Three Spinners is currently seeking a community member who is dedicated to social justice and activism, and looking to become more involved in the immigrant and refugee community in Champaign-Urbana as the Vice-President on our Board of Directors. The position would entail leadership responsibilities predominantly in the realms of case management and event planning, but would include other areas as needs arise. Experience in social work and/or case management is preferred. Bilingual and multilingual candidates are very much encouraged to apply. Time commitment varies based on the time of year and events planned; however, an average week would require 1-5 hours and a heavy week would require 5-15 hours, with flexibility around typical and atypical work schedules. The Vice-President would report to the President of the organization and would assist on Educational, Housing, and Event Planning Committees. Please respond with a resume and brief letter of interest/cover letter to alex@threespinners.org. All Three Spinners board member positions are volunteer-based and unpaid.

Location: 500 E Second St. Jackson Ellis Community Center Homer, IL 61849
Description: Peace Meal Senior Nutrition Program is looking for volunteers to help deliver meals to seniors in your community. Peace Meal participants receive a noon meal five days a week, enabling many to remain independent and in their homes. Volunteers pick up meals at the local site and deliver them to participants. The delivery route takes less than an hour to complete.

Peace Meal Senior Nutrition Program is looking for volunteers to help deliver meals to seniors in your community. Peace Meal participants receive a noon meal five days a week, enabling many to remain independent and in their homes. Volunteers pick up meals at the local site and deliver them to participants. The delivery route takes less than an hour to complete.

Location: Rantoul Peace Meal 520 E Wabash Ave. Rantoul , IL 61866
Description: Peace Meal Senior Nutrition Program is looking for volunteers to help deliver meals to seniors in your community. Peace Meal participants receive a noon meal five days a week, enabling many to remain independent and in their homes. Volunteers pick up meals at the local site and deliver them to participants. The delivery route takes 60-90 minutes to complete.

Event Name: Champaign Public Library: Maintenance Department - Cleaning Volunteer
Description: Volunteer assist the maintenance staffs with cleaning and maintenance of the main library. Tasks include vacuuming carpets, wiping desk surfaces and bookshelves, and other general cleaning tasks. Applicants must be 16 years or older. Volunteers are needed for the following days and times:

Event Name: Douglass Branch Library: Group Volunteer Project
Description: The library is offering group cleaning projects for groups of two to five adults (18 years or older) interested in a one-time project. Groups are needed to clean library bookshelves at the Douglass Branch Library from 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. on February 8th, March 7th, April 4th and May 2nd. Douglass Branch Library is located on 504 E. Grove Street, Champaign, IL 61820.

The Salvation Army is looking for a responsible Volunteer Administrative Assistant to perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks. Duties of the Volunteer Office Assistanct include providing support to our managers and employees, assisting in daily office needs and managing our telephone system.

The Salvation Army is looking for a volunteer who is interested in participating in our Youth Basketball Ministry Program. This is an open gym opportunity for youths in the area. In this position we watch over youth participants during their after school activities as well as provide ministry to those in need.

Come one, come all! 
You are invited to a great time of fun and learning for School Age kids. Every evening we will have a snack, games, activities, crafts and sharing together. Volunteers are needed to help support staff in facilitating youth group programming for Youth Night. Every Thursday at the Citadel Corps.
The Larkin’s Place Staff will provide support to the programs connected with Larkin’s Place.  Provide support for the programs based on the mission of the Y.

We have an opening for a half-time administrative assistant to help manage our day to day operations. Responsibilities include basic bookkeeping, event support, database management and general office support.  The volunteer would also

Event Name: Champaign Public Library: Children's Services - Program Volunteer (Monday Morning)
Description: Volunteers are needed on Morning mornings from 9:30 am to 11:15 am for children's programming (Babies Love Books). The program volunteer will help the librarian get ready for story time, distribute name tags to children, and count the number of people attending the program. The volunteer may also assist the librarian within the story time as needed and aids in clean up. Volunteers 18 years or older are welcome at this time.

Works with the Children's Case Manager and helps supervise childrens play activities, set up snacks, read with children, etc. Must be 18 or older. Children's Program Times: Tuesday 9am-11am, Tuesday 5pm-7pm, Wednesday 9am-12pm, Volunteer must make a regular, weekly commitment. The individual doesn't necessarily have to be available for all shifts listed, but must be available each week for their chosen time slot. Volunteer must submit an application: http://courageconnection.org/get-involved/volunteer/opportunities/volunt.... Once application has been reviewed, Courage Connection will directly contact the individual.

Courage Connection is begining the process to add Volunteers to be trainined to cover the Domestic Violence Hotline answering calls, intake, etc. Must be 18 or older. Must have completed 40 hour Domestic Violence Advocacy  Volunteer must make a regular, weekly commitment. The individual doesn't necessarily have to be available for all shifts listed, but must be available each week for their chosen time slot.

Event Name: Champaign Public Library: Children's Services Office Volunteer - Monday or Wednesday
Description: Children's Services office volunteers will assist Children's Services staff with a variety of tasks. Some of these may include alphabetizing books, preparing craft projects, straightening book shelves, locating lost books, as well as many other tasks. Adult (older than 18 years) volunteers are welcome.

Event Name: Champaign Public Library: FriendShop Bookstore - Kiosk Volunteer
Description: Volunteers are needed to assist the FriendShop used bookstore by staffing a kiosk in the library lobby.  Kiosk volunteers greet library customers, give out coupons for free books, sell books, and answer questions about the FriendShop.  Shifts are for one to two hours on Saturdays between 11:30 a.m. - 3:45  p.m. and on Sundays between 1:30 p.m. - 3:45 p.m.  Volunteers should be able to work at least once a month. Adult volunteers (over 18 years) are welcome at this time.

Event Name: Champaign Public Library: Douglass Branch - Club Fred Program Volunteer
Description: Volunteers are needed to assist with library Club Fred programming at the Douglass Branch Library. Volunteers will assist children and teens with board games, videogames, arts and crafts, and other recreational activities. Volunteers are needed Monday and Tuesday afternoons, 2:30 p.m. to 5:30 p.m.  Adult volunteers (18 years or older) are welcome. The Douglass Branch Library is located at 504 E. Grove Street, Champaign, IL 61820.

Event Name: Champaign Public Library: Douglass Branch - DIY Program Volunteers
Description: Volunteers are needed to assist with library DIY programming at the Douglass Branch Library. Volunteers will assist children with DIY (crafts, science projects, etc.) programs. Volunteers are needed Wednesday afternoons, 3:30 pm to 5:30 pm.  Adult volunteers (18 years or older) are welcome.

Event Name: Champaign Public Library: Children's Services - Program Volunteer (Thursday Afternoon)
Description: Volunteers are needed on Thursday afternoons 3:00 pm to 5:00 pm to assist with the Library program, Afternoon Adventures. Volunteers will help the librarian get ready for the program, assist during the program as needed, and help with clean-up. Adult volunteers (18 years or older) are welcome.

Event Name: Champaign Public Library: Douglass Branch - Thursday Program Volunteer
Description: Volunteers are needed to assist with rotating tween and tech programming at the Douglass Branch Library. Volunteers will assist children and teens with arts and crafts, STEM activities, and other programs. Volunteers are needed Thursday afternoons, 3:30 p.m. - 5:30 p.m.  Adult volunteers (18 years or older) are welcome. The Douglass Branch Library is located at 504 E. Grove Street, Champaign, IL 61820.

Event Name: Salt & Light Grocery and Thrift Stores
Description: Salt & Light's community grocery and thrift stores are staffed every day with volunteers. Both Champaign and Urbana locations are open from 9am-8pm Monday through Saturday, and Urbana is open on Sundays from 11am-5pm; all of these hours are available for volunteer help. We have a wide variety of volunteer tasks needed, such as greeting or bagging in the store, receiving donations in our drive-throughs, sorting, pricing, and preparing donations in our processing areas, and stocking and staging items on the retail floor.

Salt & Light's mission is to share God's love by fighting poverty, with opportunities that empower people for lasting change. Our community grocery stores and thrift stores create opportunities for people to do that every day, through skills they gain and relationships they make by volunteering, and credit they earn that allows them to buy the things they need for their families. Each day, we receive calls from people in need in our community with questions about how they can get connected with us, volunteers and members with questions or messages for our staff, representatives from vendors who supply us and other organizations that partner with us, and the community members who donate and shop in our stores that help keep the whole thing working. Our volunteer receptionists are the ones who take those calls.

PURPOSE AND FUNCTION: The Technology Center Team supports Salt & Light's vision and mission by assisting participants with general computer problems during daily open lab times. Volunteers create and maintain positive and comfortable atmospheres where users feel motivated to assimilate information and learn.

Event Name: Tutors and Volunteers needed! ( August through May)
Description: Are you a college student looking to gain volunteer hours or a citizen looking for fun and interesting ways to positively interact and affect middle school children's lives? If so, Franklin Middle School needs your help and would love to have you as part of our "Franklin Family". We are currently looking for volunteers in all subject areas, including some after-school clubs and organizations (e.g. Spanish Homework Club, Science Olympiad, READY Program). The school day is from 8-2:50, and we appreciate volunteers who are able to stay long term, as this helps with building stronger relationships with our students and teachers. Please feel free to contact Kristin Gardner, the volunteer coordinator for Franklin, at gardnerkr@u4sd.org or call at 217.351.3819. We look forward to hearing from you!

Event Name: Champaign Public Library: Access Services - Shelving Volunteer
Description: Volunteers are needed to assist the Library with shelving  library materials and checking library shelves to ensure library materials  are neat and orderly on the shelf. This includes the physical ability to handle and lift library materials (weighing approximately 40 pounds) and ability to push fully loaded carts of library materials. Volunteers also pull requested materials from the library's  collection.    Both individual and group adult (over 18 years old) volunteers are welcome.  Volunteers  are currently  welcome during the following days and times:

Gift Shop volunteers play an essential role within the Carle Auxiliary by assisting customers with purchases at retail locations.  Volunteers also help with visual display of merchandise and special events at the gift shops.  Proceeds generated from gift shops benefit the Carle Auxiliary Guest House, which provides complimentary overnight lodging for parents of babies within the NICU and family members of other critically ill patients.  Gift shop proceeds also support local scholarships for students majoring in nursing and other health occupations.

Event Name: Champaign Public Library: Group Volunteer Projects - Teen after-school program Volunteers
Description: Champaign Public Library: Group Volunteer Projects - Teen after-school program Volunteers

Event Name: Champaign Public Library: Main Library - Group Volunteer Project
Description: The library offers group projects for groups of five to eight adults (18 years or older) interested in one time projects. Group volunteer projects can include collection maintenance, cleaning work in the maintenance department, or assisting with special programming

We would love volunteers to assist with the following: (a) tutoring, (b) webdesign, (c) accounting (experience with Quickbooks), (d) business finance and marketing, (e) human resources, (f) grant writing, and (e) mentoring.  For additional information, please send an email WeRGIRLS@gmail.com

The Carle Auxiliary Guest House provides complimentary overnight lodging for parents of NICU babies and families of critically ill patients.  Guest House volunteers offer comfort and hospitality by greeting guests, answering phone calls, completing referral paperwork, and collaborating with Guest House management and staff to provide a warm and welcoming home away from home.

Connection’s Resale Store in Lincoln Square Mall is the place to find great clothing and household items at incredibly affordable prices.Volunteers unpack, sort, hang, pace andmove merchandise working with a Connections Assocaite. The ability to lift boxes of donations and piles of clothing is required. Must possess an appreciation for apparel, home goods and have a desire to work with the public.
